PREFACE
         This code of the Village of North Utica, as supplemented, contains
ordinances up to and including ordinance 2025-08, passed May 1, 2025.
Ordinances of the Village adopted after said ordinance supersede the provisions
of this code to the extent that they are in conflict or inconsistent therewith.
Consult the Village office in order to ascertain whether any particular
provision of the code has been amended, superseded or repealed.
                     American Legal Publishing
                     Cincinnati, Ohio

ORDINANCE NO. 2023 - 04
 
 
AN ORDINANCE AMENDING
ORDINANCE 2021-09 GOVERNING OUTDOOR DINING
WITHIN THE VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA, ILLINOIS
(Sec. 13 of Ord. 2021-09)
 
 
   WHEREAS, the Village of North Utica (the “Village”) is a home-rule
municipality in accordance with the Constitution of the State of Illinois of
1970; and
 
   WHEREAS, on March 9, 2020, the Governor of Illinois declared all counties in
the State of Illinois as a disaster area due to a new and significant outbreak
of Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) that had emerged in late 2019; and
 
   WHEREAS, on March 11, 2020, the World Health Organization characterized the
COVID-19 outbreak as a pandemic; and
 
WHEREAS, on March 16, 2020, the Governor of Illinois by Executive Order No.
2020-07 declared that all businesses in the State of Illinois that offer food
or beverages for on premises consumption - including restaurants, bars, grocery
stores, and food halls – must suspend service for and may not permit on-
premises consumption; and
 
WHEREAS, on May 5, 2020, the Governor of Illinois announced the RESTORE
ILLINOIS PLAN to re-open the State; and
 
WHEREAS, commercial business tenants suffering economic loss and hardship
attributable to COVID-19 and restrictions set forth in the aforementioned
Executive Orders of the Governor of Illinois (the “Affected Business Tenants”)
include those entities engaged in restaurant and bar activities on Mill Street
between Canal Street and Church Street in downtown Utica, Illinois; and
 
WHEREAS, on May 24, 2020, the Illinois Department of Commerce and Economic
Opportunity issued guidelines for Outdoor Dining for Restaurants and Bars in
Phase 3 of the Restore Illinois Plan allowing such to open on May 29,2020
provided a region is in Phase 3 of the Restore Illinois Plan, but prohibiting
such on public sidewalks; and
 
WHEREAS, the Village of North Utica Board of Trustees previously passed
Ordinances allowing partial closure of Mill Street from all vehicle traffic,
except emergency vehicles for specified dates and times to permit Outdoor
Dining operations on Mill Street; and
WHEREAS, the Village of North Utica Board of Trustees previously passed
Ordinance No. 2021-09 on March 11, 2021 to extend outdoor dining operations on
certain sections of Mill Street for a three (3) year period; and
 
WHEREAS, after consideration, Village Ordinance No. 2021-09, as amended,
Section 13, Future Years, shall be further amended.
 
   WHEREAS, the Board of Trustees of the Village of North Utica, LaSalle
County, Illinois, (the “Village”), after full consideration and evaluation has
determined that it is the best interest of the community and those effected
commercial establishments to further amend such ordinance as follows:
 
   NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE PRESIDENT AND BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF THE
VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA, LASALLE COUNTY, ILLINOIS, AS FOLLOWS:
 
SECTION 1:   Section 13: Future Years, of Ordinance 2021-09, as amended by
Ordinance 2021-41, shall be amended as follows:
 
“SECTION 13: FUTURE YEARS. Outdoor dining shall also be permitted in years,
2022, 2023, 2024, and 2025 from a date in May   April of each year to a date in
October of each year as designated annually by the Village Board of Trustee.
The Village Board of Trustees may consider a further extension of this
Ordinance at its discretion.”
(Ord.2021-09, 03-11-2021; amd. Ord#2021-12, 04-08-2021; Ord#2021-41, 12-09-
2021; Ord.#2023-04, 03-09-2023)
 
SECTION 2: APPLICABILITY. All provisions of 2021-09, and as amended by
Ordinance 2021-41 and Ordinance 2021-12, and except as specifically modified
within this Amendment, shall remain in full force and effect for Outdoor Dining
during the Traffic Closure Period.
  
SECTION 3: CONFLICTS. All parts of Ordinances or Amendment in conflict herewith
are hereby repealed.
 
SECTION 4: EFECTIVE DATE. This Ordinance is adopted pursuant to the home-rule
authority of the Village and shall be in full force and effect from and after
its passage, approval and publication in the manner provided by law.

VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA

ORDINANCE NO. 2023 - 05
 
AN ORDINANCE AMENDING THE ZONING ORDINANCE
BY THE VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA, LASALLE COUNTY, ILLINOIS
(Sec. 10-2-2 Definitions, Sec. 10-4-5 Mobile Homes, & Sec. 10-8B-3 (C2) Special
Uses)
(Coffee Vendor-Trailer)
________________________________________________________________________
 
WHEREAS, the Village of North Utica is a home-rule municipality in accordance
with the Constitution of the State of Illinois of 1970; and    
 
WHEREAS, Ordinance 04-26 adopted September 22, 2004, as amended, of the Village
Code governs zoning; and
 
WHEREAS, the Planning Commission held a public hearing on March 23, 2023,
regarding amending said Zoning Ordinance; and
 
WHEREAS, the Planning Commission has recommended by a vote of 5-voting Aye, 0-
voting Nay, 1-Absent, and the Chair not voting, that the amendment contained
herein to the Zoning Ordinance be adopted; and
 
   WHEREAS, the Board of Trustees of the Village of North Utica, LaSalle
County, Illinois, (the “Village”), after full investigation and consideration,
has determined it to be in the best interests of the citizens of the Village,
and further believe it to be necessary and appropriate that the Zoning
Ordinance of the Village Code be amended as follows below:
 
   NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE PRESIDENT AND BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF THE
VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA, LASALLE COUNTY, ILLINOIS, AS FOLLOWS:
 
SECTION 1:   Title 10, Chapter 2-2, Definitions, is amended to add the
following definition as shown on Exhibit A which is incorporated herein by
reference.
 
SECTION 2: Title 10, Chapter 4-5.B, Mobile Homes, Location in Parks Only, is
amended as shown on Exhibit B , which is incorporated herein by reference.
   
SECTION 3:   Title 10, Chapter 8B-3, C-2 General Commercial District, Special
Uses, of the Village Code is amended as shown on Exhibit C , which is
incorporated herein by reference.
 
SECTION 4:   Other Ordinances: Any other Village Ordinances existing as of the
date which are in conflict with this Ordinance are hereby repealed. This
Ordinance shall supercede where inconsistent with any and all ordinances in
conflict herewith.
 
SECTION 5:   Severability: In the event that any part or portion of this
Ordinance, or any provision, clause, wording, or designation contained within
this Ordinance, is held to be invalid by any court of competent jurisdiction,
such part, portion, provision, clause, wording, or designation shall be excised
from this Ordinance and the invalidity thereof shall not affect the remaining
portions of this Ordinance.
 
SECTION 6:   This Ordinance is adopted pursuant to the home-rule authority of
the Village and shall be in full force and effect from and after its passage,
approval, and publication in pamphlet form as required by law.
 
PRESENTED, PASSED and ACCEPTED at a regular meeting of the Board of Trustees of
the Village of North Utica, Illinois on 13 th day of April, 2023.

EXHIBIT A
 
TITLE 10, CHAPTER 2
 
RULES AND DEFINITIONS
 
 
10-2-2:    DEFINITIONS:
 
 
COFFEE VENDOR-     A small self-contained structure where no food preparation
occurs and TRAILER      where coffee is the primary beverage offered for sale,
in addition to other
          non-alcoholic beverages, snacks, and similar products.
          (Ord. No. 2023-05, 04/13/2023)
 
 
 
 
 
 
EXHIBIT B
 
TITLE 10, CHAPTER 4
 
GENERAL ZONING PROVISIONS 
 
 
10-4-5      MOBILE HOMES:
 
B.   Location in Parks Only: Mobile homes used as residences, commercial uses,
or storage shall only be located on lots in approved mobile home parks, except
such may be permitted as a Special use in the C-2 General Commercial District,
provided such are located on a lot with a permanent structure containing an
operating commercial business on the same lot.
(Ord. 2007-24, 8-8-2007; Amd Ord. 2023-05, 04-13-2023)
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
EXHIBIT C
 
TITLE 10, CHAPTER 8
 
COMMERCIAL DISTRICT
 
 
ARTICLE B. C-2 GENERAL COMMERCIAL DISTRICT
 
 
10-8B-3:   Special Uses:
      
Coffee Vendor/Trailer or Mobile Home, provided such is located on a lot
that has a permanent structure with an operating commercial business
located on the same lot.
(Ord. No.2023-05, 04/13/2023)

ORDINANCE NO. 2023 - 07
 
AN ORDINANCE AMENDING THE ZONING ORDINANCE REGARDING
SIGNS (TITLE 10-CHAPTER 15) CORRECTING SCRIVENER ERROR
BY THE VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA, LASALLE COUNTY, ILLINOIS
________________________________________________________________________
 
WHEREAS, the Village of North Utica is a home-rule municipality in accordance
with the Constitution of the State of Illinois of 1970; and
 
WHEREAS, Ordinance 04-26 adopted September 22, 2004, of the Village Code
governs zoning; and
 
   WHEREAS, the Planning Commission held public hearings on May 26, 2022, July
7, 2022, July 28, 2022, August 25, 2022, September 28, 2022, October 6, 2022,
and October 27, 2022, regarding amendments of said Zoning Ordinance as to Signs
(Title 10-Chapter 15); and
 
   WHEREAS, on October 27, 2022 the Planning Commission unanimously recommended
certain amendments to the Sign Ordnance, such recommendations having been
received and reviewed by the Village Board of Trustees; and
 
   WHEREAS, the Village Board of Trustees previously passed Ordinance No. 2022-
37 on November 17, 2022, amending various sections of Title 10-Chapter 15 of
the Zoning Ordinance; and
 
   WHEREAS, upon review, it was discovered that Title 10-Chapter 15-Section 7
Item I.1 contained a scrivener’s error; and
 
   WHEREAS, the Board of Trustees of the Village of North Utica, LaSalle
County, Illinois, (the “Village”), after full investigation and consideration,
has determined it to be in the best interests of the citizens of the Village,
and further believe it to be necessary and appropriate that the Zoning
Ordinance of the Village Code be amended to correct a scrivener’
 
   NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE PRESIDENT AND BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF THE
VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA, LASALLE COUNTY, ILLINOIS, AS FOLLOWS:
 
SECTION 1:   Ordinance 04-26 (The Zoning Ordinance) of the Village Code, as
amended, at Title 10, Chapter 15, I. Banner Signs, is further amended as shown
on Exhibit “A”, which is incorporated herein by reference, in order to correct
a scrivener’s error in Ordinance No. 2022-37.
 
SECTION 2:   Other Ordinances: Any other Village Ordinances existing as of the
date which are in conflict with this Ordinance are hereby repealed. This
Ordinance shall supercede where inconsistent with any and all ordinances in
conflict herewith.
 
SECTION 3:   Severability: In the event that any part or portion of this
Ordinance, or any provision, clause, wording, or designation contained within
this Ordinance, is held to be invalid by any court of competent jurisdiction,
such part, portion, provision, clause, wording, or designation shall be excised
from this Ordinance and the invalidity thereof shall not affect the remaining
portions of this Ordinance.
 
SECTION 4:   Effective Date: This Ordinance is adopted pursuant to the home-
rule authority of the Village and shall be in full force and effect from and
after its passage, approval, and publication in pamphlet form as required by
law.

EXHIBIT A
 
CHAPTER 15
 
SIGNS
 
 
10-15-7:   SIGNS PERMITTED IN COMMERCIAL AND INDUSTRIAL DISTRICTS:
 
I.   Banner Signs:  (Amd. Ord#2022-37, 11-17-2022)
 
1.    Up to three (3) single-pole banner signs, that are required to be
attached to a building located on the premise, not to exceed six feet (6’) in
horizontal length and twelve feet (12’) in vertical height as measured from the
ground, are permitted on private property in the C-1, C-2, and C-3 Districts,
except for locations in the C-1 District, located on Mill Street, in which only
one (1) single-pole banner sign is permitted. They can only advertise the
business, products, and/or services offered on the site. The zoning enforcement
officer has the authority to remove or cause to be moved any banner sign that
he/she deems, in his/her sole discretion, to be a safety hazard.
(Amd. Ord#2023-___, 04-13-2023)

ORDINANCE NO. 2023 - 08
 
AN ORDINANCE AMENDING THE ZONING ORDINANCE
BY THE VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA, LASALLE COUNTY, ILLINOIS
(Sec. 10-2-2 Definitions; Sec. 10-7B-2 (R-2) Permitted Uses; Sec. 10-7C-3 (R-3)
Special Uses; Sec. 10-7D-3 (R-R) Special Uses; Sec. 10-8A-3 (C-1) Special Uses;
Sec. 10-8B-3 (C-2) Special Uses; & Sec. 10-8C-3 (C-3) Special Uses)
(Shipping Containers)
________________________________________________________________________
 
WHEREAS, the Village of North Utica is a home-rule municipality in accordance
with the Constitution of the State of Illinois of 1970; and    
 
WHEREAS, Ordinance 04-26 adopted September 22, 2004, as amended, of the Village
Code governs zoning; and
 
WHEREAS, the Planning Commission held a public hearing on April 27, 2023,
regarding amending said Zoning Ordinance; and
 
WHEREAS, the Planning Commission has recommended by a vote of 4-voting Aye, 0-
voting Nay, 2-Absent, and the Chair not voting, that the amendment contained
herein to the Zoning Ordinance be adopted; and
 
   WHEREAS, the Board of Trustees of the Village of North Utica, LaSalle
County, Illinois, (the “Village”), after full investigation and consideration,
has determined it to be in the best interests of the citizens of the Village,
and further believe it to be necessary and appropriate that the Zoning
Ordinance of the Village Code be amended as follows below:
 
   NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE PRESIDENT AND BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF THE
VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA, LASALLE COUNTY, ILLINOIS, AS FOLLOWS:
 
SECTION 1:   Title 10, Chapter 2-2, Definitions, is amended to add the
following definition as shown on Exhibit A which is incorporated herein by
reference.
 
SECTION 2: Title 10, Chapter 7, Residential Districts, Article B-2, R-
2 Permitted Uses, Article C-3, R-3 Special Uses, and Article D-3, R-R Special
Uses, are all amended as shown on Exhibit B , which is incorporated herein by
reference.
   
SECTION 3:   Title 10, Chapter 8, Commercial Districts, Articles A, B, and C,
(C-1, C-2, and C-3), all at Section 3, Special Uses of each Article, of the
Village Code are all amended to add the use of Shipping Containers as shown on
Exhibit C , which is incorporated herein by reference.
 
SECTION 4:   Other Ordinances: Any other Village Ordinances existing as of the
date which are in conflict with this Ordinance are hereby repealed. This
Ordinance shall supercede where inconsistent with any and all ordinances in
conflict herewith.
 
SECTION 5:   Severability: In the event that any part or portion of this
Ordinance, or any provision, clause, wording, or designation contained within
this Ordinance, is held to be invalid by any court of competent jurisdiction,
such part, portion, provision, clause, wording, or designation shall be excised
from this Ordinance and the invalidity thereof shall not affect the remaining
portions of this Ordinance.
 
SECTION 6:   This Ordinance is adopted pursuant to the home-rule authority of
the Village and shall be in full force and effect from and after its passage,
approval, and publication in pamphlet form as required by law.

10-2-2:    DEFINITIONS:
 
 
SHIPPING CONTAINERS:   Containers or boxes made of steel or other metals, that
are commonly used for the storage and movement of materials in the freight
transportation system.

ORDINANCE NO. 2023 - 11
 
 
AN ORDINANCE AUTHORIZING AN INCREASE IN THE LIMIT FOR
HOT MIX ASPHALT PAVING CATEGORY
BY THE VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA, LASALLE COUNTY, ILLINOIS
 
 
 
 
Date Passed:      May 11, 2023
 
Date Posted:      May 11, 2023
 
 
 
 
DO NOT REMOVE FOR 10 DAYS
FROM DATE OF POSTING
   
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
File #15-184-01
 
VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA
LASALLE COUNTY,
ILLINOIS
 
ORDINANCE NO. 2023 – 11
 
AN ORDINANCE AUTHORIZING AN INCREASE IN THE LIMIT FOR
HOT MIX ASPHALT PAVING CATEGORY
BY THE VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA, LASALLE COUNTY, ILLINOIS
 
________________________________________________________________________
 
   WHEREAS, the Village of North Utica (the “Village”) is a home-rule
municipality in accordance with the Constitution of the State of Illinois of
1970; and
 
   WHEREAS, the Village Engineer has recommended to the Village Board of
Trustees that it increase the limit for Hot Mix Asphalt Paving, which is
Category 5 in the Illinois Department of Transportation’s (IDOT) Work Category
List, from the standard 1,200 ton limit, to no more than 3,000 tons in any one
contract; and
 
   WHEREAS, the Village Board of Trustees, after full consideration, has
determined that the recommended increase in the Hot Mix Asphalt Paving category
is in the best interests of the Village.
 
   NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE PRESIDENT AND BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF THE
VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA, LASALLE COUNTY, ILLINOIS, AS FOLLOWS:
 
SECTION 1:   It is hereby agreed that the Village increase the limit for Hot
Mix Asphalt (HMA) Paving (Category 5 in IDOT’s Work Category List) to no more
than 3,000 tons in any one Contract. This increase thereby waives the
requirement of ownership of an approved HMA Plant for Contracts including less
than 3,000 tons of asphalt.
 
SECTION 2:    The Village President and Village Clerk are authorized to execute
documentation required, if any.
 
SECTION 3:   This Ordinance is adopted pursuant to the home-rule authority of
the Village and shall be in full force and effect from and after its passage,
approval, and publication in pamphlet form as required by law.

   PRESENTED, PASSED AND ACCEPTED at a special meeting of the Board of Trustees
of the Village of North Utica, Illinois on the 11 th day of May 2023.

VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA
LASALLE COUNTY,
ILLINOIS
 
ORDINANCE NO. 2023 - 15
 
AN ORDINANCE
AMENDING THE ADMINISTRATION ORDINANCE
OF THE VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA, LASALLE COUNTY, ILLINOIS
(Title 1-Chapter 6- Section 3 and Section 4)
________________________________________________________________________
   
WHEREAS, the Village of North Utica (the “Village”) is a Home Rule Municipality
in accordance with the Constitution of the State of Illinois, 1970; and
 
WHEREAS, The Board of Trustees of the Village of North Utica, LaSalle County,
Illinois (“the Village”), after full investigation and consideration, has
determined it to be in the best interests of the citizens of the Village, and
where it is further believed to be necessary and appropriate that the
Administration, Title 1, Chapter 6, Section 3, Meetings, and Section 4, Rules
of Order, of the Village’s Ordinances, be amended as follows below:
 
   NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE PRESIDENT AND BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF THE
VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA, LASALLE COUNTY, ILLINOIS, AS FOLLOWS:
 
SECTION 1:   Title 1, Chapter 6, Section 3 Meetings, A. Regular Meetings, 1.
Place, Day, and Time, shall be stricken and replaced by the following:
 
1-6-3:   MEETINGS:   
 
A.    Regular Meetings:
 
1.    Place, Day and Time: The village board shall hold its regular meetings at
the Village Hall on the second Thursday of each month at seven  six o’clock (7 
6: 00) P.M. commencing on July 13, 2023 . (1966 Code §8; amd. 2013 Code; amd
Ord.#2017-32, 12-13-2017; amd Ord.#2023-___, 06-15-2023)
 
SECTION 2:   Title 1, Chapter 6, Section 4 Rules of Order, H. Committees, 1.
Standing Committees, shall be deleted in its entirety and replaced with the
following:
 
   1-6-4:   RULES OF ORDER:
 
   H.   Committees:
 
1.    Committee of The Whole: A Committee of the Whole shall consist of all
members of the Village Board of Trustees and Village President, and hold its
regular meetings at the Village Hall on the fourth Thursday of each month at
seven  six o’clock (7  6 :00) P.M. commencing on July 27, 2023.    (1966
Code§17; amd. 2013 Code; amd. by Ord#2017-32, 12-13-2017; amd Ord#2023-___, 06-
15-2023)
 
SECTION 3: All parts of Ordinances or Amendments in conflict herewith are
hereby repealed.
 
SECTION 4: That this Ordinance is adopted pursuant to the home-rule authority
of the Village and shall be in full force and effect after its passage and
approval, and publication in pamphlet form and in a newspaper of general
circulation as required by law.

adopted at a special meeting of the Board of Trustees of the Village of North
Utica, Illinois on the 15 th day of June, 2023 by roll call vote as follows:

ORDINANCE NO. 2023 - 18
 
 
 
AN ORDINANCE AMENDING ORDINANCES
REGARDING WATER/SEWER FEES FOR
THE VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA, LA SALLE COUNTY, ILLINOIS
(8-1-8)
 
 
 
 
Date Passed:      August 10, 2023
 
Date Posted:      August 10, 2023
 
 
 
 
 
 
DO NOT REMOVE FOR 10 DAYS
FROM DATE OF POSTING
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA
LASALLE COUNTY, ILLINOIS
 
ORDINANCE NO. 2023 – 18
 
AN ORDINANCE AMENDING ORDINANCES
REGARDING WATER/SEWER FEES FOR
THE VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA, LA SALLE COUNTY, ILLINOIS
(8-1-8)
________________________________________________________________________
 
WHEREAS, the Village of North Utica is a home-rule municipality in accordance
with the Constitution of the State of Illinois of 1970; and
 
WHEREAS, on April 10, 2013, the Village of North Utica, LaSalle County,
Illinois (“the Village”), adopted Ordinance No. 2013-08, Approving the Village
Code Book and Codifying its Ordinances; and
 
WHEREAS, Title 8, Public Services, regulates water and sewer rates and charges;
and
 
WHEREAS, the Board of Trustees believes it necessary and in the best interests
of the Village to amend said Ordinance as contained herein.
 
   NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE PRESIDENT AND BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF THE
VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA, LASALLE COUNTY, ILLINOIS, AS FOLLOWS:
 
SECTION 1:    That the language set forth in Title 8, Chapter 1, Section 8,
Fees, Rates and Charges Established, under B. User Rates, shall be amended as
follows:
 
B:   User Rates:
 
1.    The established rates for water and sewer service shall be as follows:
 
Water User            Rate
 
Residential (non-metered):         $11.50 / month1,3
 
Single-family and duplex         $11.50 per first 1000 gals. (min) per user1
residential (metered):         $1.60 $2.25 per each 1000 gals. thereafter1
 
Multiple-family   residential      $11.50 per first 1000 gals. (min) per user1
(metered):            $1.60 $2.25 per each 1000 gals. thereafter1
 
Commercial (non-metered):      $60.00 per month per user1
 
 
Commercial (metered):         $14.00 per first 1000 gals. (min) per user1
               $1.70 $2.25 per each 1000 gals. thereafter1
 
Industrial:            $3.20 per 1000 gals.1
               (amd Ord#2019-15, 5-9-2019)
 
Water Tanker/Equipment Fill      $60.00 per 1000 gals.2
 
Notes:
1.   For each separate commercial, industrial or residential dwelling user per
unit.
2.   Prior notice and consent of the Village of the date, time, and location of
the fill is required. Consent shall be given by the Mayor or the Supt. of
Public Works.
3.   The Village shall notify a residential user of the necessity to schedule
an appointment to have a new meter installed. Failure by User to schedule and
maintain a scheduled appointment within 30-days of the initial contact by the
Village shall cause the Village to issue a 10-Day Notice of Installation
Violation. Such Notice shall be provided to the User by certified mail at the
address of the premises or by personal service. If the Notice of Installation
Violation is not remedied within 10-days of delivery of the Notice, then the
non-metered rate shall increase from the Base rate of $11.50 per month to
$60.00 per month (the “Violation” rate) commencing with the next billing
period. A Notice sent by certified mail and not accepted or signed for, shall
be subject to the increased $60.00 per month fee if not remedied within 15-days
of the date of mailing by the Village. Once the violation is remedied, the non-
metered rate shall revert from the Violation rate to the Base rate commencing
with the next billing cycle until the Village commences Village wide use of the
metered rate.
 
(Ord.2012-05, 2-8-2012; amd. by 2013 Code; amd. Ord.2014-12, 5-14-2014)
 
    Sewer User            Rate
 
Residential (non-metered):      $10.25/ month1,2 (see Note 2. below)
 
Single-family and duplex      $10.25 monthly per user1
residential (metered):         $1.75 $2.25 per each 1000 gals. thereafter1
 
Multiple-family residential      $10.25 per monthly per user1
(metered):            $1.75 $2.25 per each 1,000 gals. thereafter1
 
Commercial (non-metered):      $12.25 per month per user1
 
Commercial (metered):         $15.00 per first 1000 gals. (min) per user1
               $2.85 per each 1000 gals. thereafter1
 
Industrial:            $3.20 per 1000 gals.1
               (amd. Ord#2019-15, 5-9-2019)
Notes:
1.   For each separate commercial, industrial or residential dwelling user per
unit.
2.    The Village shall notify a residential user of the necessity to schedule
an appointment to have a new meter installed. Failure by User to schedule and
maintain a scheduled appointment within 30-days of the initial contact by the
Village shall cause the Village to issue a 10-Day Notice of Installation
Violation. Such Notice shall be provided to the User by certified mail at the
address of the premises or by personal service. If the Notice of Installation
Violation is not remedied within 10-days of delivery of the Notice, then the
non-metered rate shall increase from the Base rate of $10.25 per month to
$60.00 per month (the “Violation” rate) commencing with the next billing
period. A Notice sent by certified mail and not accepted or signed for, shall
be subject to the increased $60.00 per month fee if not remedied within 15-days
of the date of mailing by the Village. Once the violation is remedied, the non-
metered rate shall revert from the Violation rate to the Base rate commencing
with the next billing cycle until the Village commences Village wide use of the
metered rate.  
 
(Ord.#2010-11, 4-14-2010; amd. by 2013 Code; amd. Ord.#2014-12, 5-14-2014)
 
   2. Upon installation of a meter and an initial reading of the meter by the
village, the user shall begin payment according to the applicable meter rate
set forth in this section. (Ord. 2001-05, 3-7-2001)
 
SECTION 2:    That the following shall be added to Title 8, Chapter 1, Section
8, as 8-1-8 F:
 
8-1-8:      FEES, RATES AND CHARGES ESTABLISHED:
 
F.   All Residential and Commercial water and sewer rates are subject to an
annual increase of four percent (4%) per year, with the first increase
occurring on January 1 2025. (Ord.#2023-18, 08-10-2023)
 
 
SECTION 3:    This Ordinance shall be in full force and effect as of October 1,
2023 and as required by law. This Ordinance may be published in pamphlet form.
 
SECTION 4:   All other ordinances, provisions of ordinances, and regulations of
the Village which are inconsistent with this Ordinance shall be superseded by
this Ordinance. This Ordinance is adopted pursuant to the home-rule authority
of the Village.

of the municipal clerk.

AN ORDINANCE AMENDING THE ZONING ORDINANCE
TITLE 10, SECTION 19 et.al
BY THE VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA, LASALLE COUNTY, ILLINOIS
(Solar Energy Systems)
 
 
 
Date Passed:      August 24, 2023

FROM DATE OF POSTING
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
File #15-67-10-7 (Solar/Geothermal)
 
VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA
LASALLE COUNTY,
ILLINOIS
 
ORDINANCE NO. 2023 – 21
 
AN ORDINANCE AMENDING THE ZONING ORDINANCE
TITLE 10, SECTION 19 et.al
BY THE VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA, LASALLE COUNTY, ILLINOIS
(Solar Energy Systems)
________________________________________________________________________
 
   WHEREAS, the Village of North Utica is a home-rule municipality in
accordance with the Constitution of the State of Illinois of 1970; and
 
   WHEREAS, the Village approved amendments to Title 10, Zoning Regulations of
the Village Zoning Ordinance by adding Chapter 19, Solar Energy System
Regulations by Village Ordinance No. 2019-34, dated December 5, 2019; and
 
   WHEREAS, the Village Board of Trustees determined that the Village should
consider amendments to the Village Zoning Ordinance for consideration of
whether, in what circumstances, and/or in which, if any zoning districts,
Ground-Mounted Solar Energy Systems may be allowed; and    
 
   WHEREAS, pursuant to notice duly published in the News Tribune on August 8,
2023, the Village Planning Commission commenced a public hearing on August 24,
2023 regarding the proposed amendment(s) and consideration as to whether, in
what circumstances, and/or in which, if any, zoning districts, Ground-Mounted
Solar Energy Systems may be allowed; and
 
   WHEREAS, the Planning Commission has recommended by a vote of 4-Aye, 0-Nay,
2-Absent, and the Chairman not voting, to amend said Zoning Ordinance finding
that the factors required by the Zoning Ordinance are fully satisfied; and
 
   WHEREAS, the Board of Trustees of the Village of North Utica, LaSalle
County, Illinois, (the “Village”), after full consideration, has determined
that the request sought satisfy the factors required by the Zoning Ordinance
and should be granted.
 
   NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE PRESIDENT AND BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF THE
VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA, LASALLE COUNTY, ILLINOIS, AS FOLLOWS:
 
SECTION 1:    An amendment is made to Title 10, Zoning Regulations, of the
Village Zoning Ordinance, Chapter 19, Solar Energy System Regulations, at
Section 1. I. Ground-Mounted Solar Energy Systems, as follows:
 
CHAPTER 19
 
SOLAR ENERGY SYSTEM REGULATIONS
 
SECTION:   
 
10-19-1:   Solar Energy System Regulations
 
I.    Ground-Mounted Solar Energy Systems: Ground-Mounted Solar Energy Systems
shall be considered special uses in all zoning districts .   except   In all
Residential Districts in which they are prohibited. the residential lot size
must be a minimum of three (3) acres in order to be considered for a special
use permit. Plans for Ground-Mounted Solar Energy Systems (excepting portable
energy systems for swimming pools) shall be subject to the issuance of a
special use permit as provided, as well as review and approval by the Village
Planning Commission. In addition to all other requirements of the special use
permit application, all applications from Ground-Mounted Solar Energy Systems
shall include the minimum data requirements identified in this Title. In
addition, plans for Ground-Mounted Solar Energy System shall comply with the
minimum standards as follows:
(amd Ord.#2023-21, 08-24-2023)
 
1.    Location:
 
a.    No Ground-Mounted Solar Energy System may be constructed within any off-
street parking or loading space required pursuant to this Code.
 
b.    Ground-Mounted Solar Energy Systems shall be located on the same lot or
parcel as the principal structure and within the rear yard of that lot or
parcel.
 
2.    Installation Angle: All solar panels of a Ground-Mounted Solar Energy
System shall be installed not greater than the maximum angle specified by the
manufacturer.
 
3.    Setbacks: In all zoning districts, all portions of Ground-Mounted Solar
Energy Systems shall comply with the generally applicable setback restrictions
for the zoning district or building setback lines as established in a PUD in
which the Ground-Mounted Solar Energy System is located, as measured from the
property line to the closes edge of the system. Ground-Mounted Solar Energy
Systems (and parts thereof) shall not be deemed a permitted obstruction in any
required yard.
 
4.    Height: The height of a Ground-Mounted Solar Energy System shall not
exceed the height limitation for accessory structures.
 
5.    Lot Coverage: The total solar panel surface area of each Ground-Mounted
Solar Energy System shall be included in the lot coverage calculations for the
property on which the system is located.
 
6.    Screening and Bufferyards: Ground-Mounted Solar Energy Systems shall be
properly screened from adjacent lots. For the purpose of this subsection,
proper screening shall be deemed to consist of permanent vegetative screening
large enough and dense enough to substantially screen the energy system from
view from adjacent lots in a manner that is consistent with the character of
the neighborhood and existing uses on the adjacent lots.
 
7.    Rotation: Ground-Mounted Solar Energy System panels may rotate not to
exceed the maximum angle as specified by the manufacturer.
 
 
SECTION 2:   This Ordinance is adopted pursuant to the home-rule authority of
the Village and shall be in full force and effect from and after its passage,
approval, and publication in pamphlet form as required by law.

ORDINANCE NO. 2023 - 23
 
AN ORDINANCE AMENDING
THE BUILDING & DEVELOPMENT ORDINANCE
BY THE VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA, LASALLE COUNTY, ILLINOIS
(Title 9-Chapter2-Section 3)
________________________________________________________________________
 
   WHEREAS, the Village of North Utica is a home-rule municipality in
accordance with the Constitution of the State of Illinois of 1970; and
 
   WHEREAS, the Board of Trustees of the Village of North Utica, LaSalle
County, Illinois, (the “Village”), after full investigation and consideration,
has determined it to be in the best interests of the citizens of the Village,
and further believe it to be necessary and appropriate that the Building &
Development, Title 9, Chapter 2, Section 3, Procedure of the Village Code be
amended as follows below:
 
   NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE PRESIDENT AND BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF THE
VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA, LASALLE COUNTY, ILLINOIS, AS FOLLOWS:
 
SECTION 1:   Title 9, Chapter 2, Design Review, at Section 3, Procedure, E.
Review and Decisions, shall be stricken and replaced by the following:
 
   9-2-3:   PROCEDURE:
 
   E.   Review and Decisions:
 
1.    The DRC shall review each application for conformance with the Village
downtown design guidelines as attached to the ordinance codified herein and
made a part hereof.
 
2.    If the DRC approves a plan, they shall recommend such to be brought to
the Village Board of Trustees for final approval. If the Village Board of
Trustees approves a plan , a building permit shall then be issued; provided,
that all other requirements of all other applicable village codes and
ordinances are satisfied.
 
3.    If the DRC does not approve a plan, the applicant shall be notified by
certified mail, return receipt requested. The applicant may appeal the DRC’s
decision to the Village Board of Trustees.
(amd Ord.#2023-23, 08-24-2023)
SECTION 2:   Other Ordinances: Any other Village Ordinances existing as of the
date which are in conflict with this Ordinance are hereby repealed. This
Ordinance shall supersede where inconsistent with any and all ordinances in
conflict herewith.
 
SECTION 3:   Severability: In the event that any part or portion of this
Ordinance, or any provision, clause, wording, or designation contained within
this Ordinance, is held to be invalid by any court of competent jurisdiction,
such part, portion, provision, clause, wording, or designation shall be excised
from this Ordinance and the invalidity thereof shall not affect the remaining
portions of this Ordinance.
 
SECTION 4:   That this Ordinance is adopted pursuant to the home-rule authority
of the Village and shall be in full force and effect after its passage and
approval, and publication in pamphlet form as required by law.

ON THE 14th DAY OF SEPTEMBER 2023.
 
 
 
 
 
DO NOT REMOVE FOR 10-DAYS FROM DATE OF POSTING
 
 
 
 
File #15-67-03
VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA,
COUNTY OF LASALLE,
STATE OF ILLINOIS
 
ORDINANCE NO. 2023 - 26
 
AN ORDINANCE AMENDING THE BUSINESS & LICENSE REGULATIONS
OF THE VILLAGE CODE ORDINANCE
OF THE VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA, LASALLE COUNTY, ILLINOIS
(Title 3-Chapter 13-Raffles)
 
 
PREAMBLE
   WHEREAS, the Village of North Utica (the “Village”) is a home-rule
municipality in accordance with the Constitution of the State of Illinois, and
has the authority to adopt ordinances and to promulgate rules and regulations
that pertain to its government affairs and that protect the public health,
safety and welfare of its citizens; and
 
   WHEREAS, previously the Village adopted Ordinance No. 2022-33 pursuant to
the provisions of 230 ILCS 15/ (“Raffles & Poker Runs Act”) and pursuant to the
home-rule authority of the Village.
   
   WHEREAS, Village Ordinance No. 2022-33 imposes regulations on raffles and/or
poker runs as provided to municipalities.
 
   WHEREAS, the Board of Trustees of the Village of North Utica, LaSalle
County, Illinois, after full consideration, believes it necessary and in the
best interest of the Village to amend Village Ordinance No. 2022-33.
 
   NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE PRESIDENT AND BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF THE
VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA, LASALLE COUNTY, ILLINOIS, THAT:
 
SECTION 1. Recitals. The facts and statements contained in the preamble to this
Ordinance are found to be true and correct and are hereby adopted as part of
this Ordinance.
 
SECTION 2.   Title 3, Business and License Regulations, Chapter 13, Raffles at
Section 2, License Required, the following paragraph C. shall be added as
follows:
 
3-13-2:      LICENSED REQUIRED:
 
C.   A license fee of Fifty dollars ($50.00) shall be payable to the Village
prior to issuance of an approved license.
 
 
SECTION 3.    Title 3, Business and License Regulations, Chapter 13, Raffles at
Section 6, Limitations on Licenses, paragraph A. shall be amended as follows:
 
3-13-6:      LIMITATIONS ON LICENSES:
 
A.   A license authorizes the licensee to conduct raffles as defined in this
chapter. Each such license is valid for one raffle. The Village issue no more
than two (2) licenses per calendar year and only one (1) raffle shall be
ongoing at any one time.  
 
The Village shall issue no more than two (2) Progressive Raffle licenses within
a calendar year and only one (1) Progressive Raffle shall be ongoing at any one
(1) time.   No organization shall be entitled to receive more than one (1)
Progressive Raffle license in a calendar year. 
 
 
SECTION 4. Severability. If any provision of this Ordinance, or the application
of any provision of this Ordinance, is held unconstitutional or otherwise
invalid, such occurrence shall not affect other provisions of this Ordinance,
or their application, that can be given effect without the unconstitutional or
invalid provision or its application. Each unconstitutional or invalid
provision, or application of such provision, is severable, unless otherwise
provided by this Ordinance.
 
SECTION 5. Effective Date. This Ordinance is adopted pursuant to the home-rule
authority of the Village and shall be in full force and effect from and after
its passage and approval and publication as required by law.

VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA
LASALLE COUNTY,
ILLINOIS
 
ORDINANCE NO. 2024 - 02
 
AN ORDINANCE AMENDING THE ZONING ORDINANCE
BY THE VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA, LASALLE COUNTY, ILLINOIS
(Sec. 10-7B-3 (R-2) Special Uses)
(Accessory Structures)
________________________________________________________________________
 
WHEREAS, the Village of North Utica is a home-rule municipality in accordance
with the Constitution of the State of Illinois of 1970; and    
 
WHEREAS, Ordinance 04-26 adopted September 22, 2004, as amended, of the Village
Code governs zoning; and
 
WHEREAS, Warren Munson and Wendy Munson, Petitioners and Contract Purchaser for
property located at the Southeast corner of Vine and E. Grove Street, Utica,
Illinois (“Subject Property”) have requested to re-subdivide part of said
property and for the granting of certain variances and special uses, in order
to construct an accessory structure on said re-subdivided lot; and
 
WHEREAS, Petitioners reside at 225 Vine Street, Utica, Illinois, which is
directly West of the Subject Property separated only by Vine Street; and
 
WHEREAS, the entire Subject Property is currently zoned R-2, Two-Family
Residential District; and
 
WHEREAS, the amendment to the Zoning Ordinance, re-subdivision, variances, and
special uses request for the Subject Property was present at a duly noticed
public hearing to the Planning Commission of the Village of North Utica on
January 9, 2024; and
 
WHEREAS, The Planning Commission has recommended by a vote of _____ voting Aye,
______ voting Nay, _______ Absent, and the Chairman not voting, that the
amendment contained herein to the Zoning Ordinance be adopted; and
 
   WHEREAS, the Board of Trustees of the Village of North Utica, LaSalle
County, Illinois, (the “Village”), after full investigation and consideration,
has determined it to be in the best interests of the citizens of the Village,
and further believe it to be necessary and appropriate that the Zoning
Ordinance of the Village Code be amended as follows below:
 
   NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE PRESIDENT AND BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF THE
VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA, LASALLE COUNTY, ILLINOIS, AS FOLLOWS:
 
SECTION 1:   Title 10, Chapter 7, Residential Districts, Article B-3, Special
Uses is amended by adding the following:
 
   “An Accessory Structure may be allowed as a Special Use on a residential lot
that is under the same ownership as the principal use and structure provided
such is separated from the principal use and structure only by a public right
of way.”
 
SECTION 2:   Other Ordinances: Any other Village Ordinances existing as of the
date which are in conflict with this Ordinance are hereby repealed. This
Ordinance shall supercede where inconsistent with any and all ordinances in
conflict herewith.
 
SECTION 3:   Severability: In the event that any part or portion of this
Ordinance, or any provision, clause, wording, or designation contained within
this Ordinance, is held to be invalid by any court of competent jurisdiction,
such part, portion, provision, clause, wording, or designation shall be excised
from this Ordinance and the invalidity thereof shall not affect the remaining
portions of this Ordinance.
 
SECTION 4:   This Ordinance is adopted pursuant to the home-rule authority of
the Village and shall be in full force and effect from and after its passage,
approval, and publication in pamphlet form as required by law.
 
 
 
 
 
 
PRESENTED, PASSED and ACCEPTED at a special meeting of the Board of Trustees of
the Village of North Utica, Illinois on 9 th day of January, 2024.

adopted at a special meeting of the Board of Trustees of the Village of North
Utica, Illinois on the 9 th day of January 2024, by roll call vote as follows:

ORDINANCE NO. 2024 - 08
 
 
AN ORDINANCE AMENDING
ORDINANCE 2021-09 GOVERNING OUTDOOR DINING
WITHIN THE VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA, ILLINOIS
(Sec. 13 of Ord. 2021-09)
 
 
   WHEREAS, the Village of North Utica (the “Village”) is a home-rule
municipality in accordance with the Constitution of the State of Illinois of
1970; and
 
   WHEREAS, the Village of North Utica Board of Trustees previously passed
Ordinances allowing partial closure of Mill Street from all vehicle traffic,
except emergency vehicles for specified dates and times to permit Outdoor
Dining operations on Mill Street; and
 
WHEREAS, the Village of North Utica Board of Trustees previously passed
Ordinance No. 2021-09 on March 11, 2021 to extend outdoor dining operations on
certain sections of Mill Street for a three (3) year period; and
 
WHEREAS, after consideration, Village Ordinance No. 2021-09, as amended,
Section 13, Future Years, shall be further amended.
 
   WHEREAS, the Board of Trustees of the Village of North Utica, LaSalle
County, Illinois, (the “Village”), after full consideration and evaluation has
determined that it is the best interest of the community and those effected
commercial establishments to further amend such ordinance as follows:
 
   NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE PRESIDENT AND BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF THE
VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA, LASALLE COUNTY, ILLINOIS, AS FOLLOWS:
 
SECTION 1:   Section 13: Future Years, of Ordinance 2021-09, as amended by
Ordinance 2021-41 and Ordinance 2023-04, shall be amended as follows:
 
“SECTION 13: FUTURE YEARS. Outdoor dining shall also be permitted in years,
2022, 2023, 2024, and 2025 from a date in April or May of each year to a date
in October of each year as designated annually by the Village Board of Trustee.
The Village Board of Trustees may consider a further extension of this
Ordinance at its discretion.”
(Ord.2021-09, 03-11-2021; amd, Ord#2021-41, 12-09-2021; Ord.#2023-04, 03-09-
2023; Ord.#2024-08, 01-09-2024)
 
SECTION 2: APPLICABILITY. All provisions of 2021-09, as amended, except as
specifically modified within this Amendment, shall remain in full force and
effect for Outdoor Dining during the Traffic Closure Period.
  
SECTION 3: CONFLICTS. All parts of Ordinances or Amendment in conflict herewith
are hereby repealed.
 
SECTION 4: EFECTIVE DATE. This Ordinance is adopted pursuant to the home-rule
authority of the Village and shall be in full force and effect from and after
its passage, approval and publication in the manner provided by law.
 
PRESENTED, PASSED and ACCEPTED at a special meeting of the Board of Trustees of
the Village of North Utica, Illinois on 9th day of January, 2024.

ORDINANCE NO. 2024 - 10
 
AN ORDINANCE AMENDING THE
PEDDLERS, SOLICITORS AND TRANSIENT MERCHANTS ORDINANCE
OF THE VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA, LASALLE COUNTY, ILLINOIS
(Sec. 3-4-1-3, B.2.a.)
 
________________________________________________________________________
 
   
WHEREAS, the Village of North Utica (the “Village”) is a Home Rule Municipality
in accordance with the Constitution of the State of Illinois, 1970; and
 
WHEREAS, Section 11-42-5 of the Illinois Municipal Code, 65 ILCS 5/11-42-5,
grants to municipal corporate authorities the authority to license, tax,
regulate or prohibit hawkers, peddlers and transient merchants; and
 
   WHEREAS, The Board of Trustees of the Village of North Utica, LaSalle
County, Illinois (“the Village”), after full investigation and consideration,
has determined it to be in the best interests of the citizens of the Village,
and further believe it to be necessary and appropriate that the Peddlers,
Solicitors and Transient Merchants Ordinance of the Village Code be amended as
related to Peddlers and Transient Merchants, but not as to Flea Markets, as
follows below:
 
   NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE PRESIDENT AND BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF THE
VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA, LASALLE COUNTY, ILLINOIS, AS FOLLOWS:
 
SECTION 1:   Section 3, Chapter 4-1-3B.2.a., Applications for Licenses; Fees:
Transient Merchants, shall be amended as follows:
 
3-4-1-3.   APPLICATIONS FOR LICENSES; FEES:
   
B.    Transient Merchants:
 
2. License Fees: The fees for transient merchant licenses shall be:
 
a.    Daily Licenses: Twenty five dollars ($25.00) for a one day license. The
total number to be annually issued for a one-day license shall not exceed three
(3) , except that on the date of the Utica Fire Department’s Craft Beer
Festival, up to six (6) licenses may be issued for a one-day license. (amd.
Ord#2024-10, 04-12-2024)
SECTION 3:   That this Ordinance is adopted pursuant to the home-rule authority
of the Village and shall be in full force and effect from and after its
passage, approval and publication as provided by law. This Ordinance may be
published in pamphlet form.
 
 
 
   UPON MOTION by Trustee __________________, seconded by Trustee
___________________, adopted at its regular meeting of the Board of Trustees of
the Village of North Utica, Illinois on the 11 th day of April, 2024, by roll
call vote as follows:

VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA
LASALLE COUNTY, ILLINOIS
 
ORDINANCE NO. 2024 – 13
 
AN ORDINANCE AMENDING THE
MOTOR VEHICLES AND TRAFFIC ORDINANCE
OF THE VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA, LASALLE COUNTY, ILLINOIS
(Title 6, Ch 6, Sec. 4)
________________________________________________________________________
 
   WHEREAS, the Village of North Utica (the “Village”) is a Home Rule
Municipality in accordance with the Constitution of the State of Illinois,
1970; and
 
WHEREAS, The Board of Trustees of the Village of North Utica, LaSalle County,
Illinois (“the Village”), after full investigation and consideration, has
determined it to be in the best interests of the citizens of the Village, and
where it is further believed to be necessary and appropriate that the Motor
Vehicles and Traffic Ordinance, Title 6, Ch 6, Section 4, Abandoned, Junk
Vehicles, Nuisance Declared, of the Village’s Ordinances, be amended as follows
below:
 
   NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE PRESIDENT AND BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF THE
VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA, LASALLE COUNTY, ILLINOIS, AS FOLLOWS:
 
SECTION 1:   Section 6-6-4 Nuisance Declared, of the Village of North Utica
Ordinance, shall be amended by adding and/or amending the following:
 
6-6-4:   NUISANCE DECLARED: The location or presence of any junked vehicle on
any lot, tract, parcel of land or portion thereof, occupied or unoccupied,
improved or unimproved, within the village shall be deemed a public nuisance,
and it shall be unlawful for any person (owner, tenant, occupant, lessee, or
otherwise) to cause or maintain such public nuisance by wrecking, dismantling,
rendering inoperable, abandoning, not moving or discarding his vehicle, or to
suffer, permit or allow the same to be placed, located, maintained or exist
upon private real property within the village for longer than seven (7) days,
or to allow the same to exist upon public real property within the village for
longer than two (2) days; provided, that this section shall not apply to: a) a
vehicle or part thereof which is completely enclosed with a building in a
lawful manner where it is not visible from the street or other public or
private property; b) a vehicle or part thereof which is stored or parked in a
lawful manner on private property in connection with the business of a licensed
vehicle dealer , or a junkyard , or located in the C-2 or C-3 Zoning Districts
and being utilized by the entity that is located on same property as a
decorative item, subject to approval of the Zoning Enforcement Officer as to
size, appearance, and location ; or c) unlicensed inoperable vehicles stored on
private property; provided, however, that the vehicles and outdoor storage
areas are maintained in such a manner that they do not constitute a health
hazard and are screened from ordinary public view by means of a fence, rapidly
growing trees or shrubbery, or other appropriate means. (Ord. 95-19, 10-4-1995;
Amd. Ord. 2024-13, 05-09-2024)   
 
SECTION 2:    All parts of Ordinances or Amendments in conflict herewith are
hereby repealed.
 
SECTION 3:   That this Ordinance is adopted pursuant to the home-rule authority
of the Village and shall be in full force and effect from and after its
passage, approval and publication in the manner provided by law.
 
 
   UPON MOTION by Trustee _______________, seconded by Trustee _______________,
adopted at its regular meeting of the Board of Trustees of the Village of North
Utica, Illinois on the 9 th day of May, 2024, by roll call vote as follows:
 
 
PRESENTED, PASSED and ACCEPTED at its regular meeting of the Board of Trustees
of the Village of North Utica, Illinois on 9 th day of May, 2024.

ORDINANCE NO. 2024 - 11
 
 
AN ORDINANCE
AMENDING THE ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGE ORDINANCE
OF THE VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA, LASALLE COUNTY, ILLINOIS
(New Sub-Class H, Temporary Event License)
 
 
 
Date Passed:      April 11, 2024
 
Date Posted:      April 11, 2024
 
 
 
DO NOT REMOVE FOR 10 DAYS
FROM DATE OF POSTING
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
File #15-73
 
VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA
LASALLE COUNTY,
ILLINOIS
 
ORDINANCE NO. 2024 - 11
 
AN ORDINANCE
AMENDING THE ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGE ORDINANCE
OF THE VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA, LASALLE COUNTY, ILLINOIS
(New Sub-Class H-Temporary Event License)
________________________________________________________________________
   
WHEREAS, the Village of North Utica (the “Village”) is a Home Rule Municipality
in accordance with the Constitution of the State of Illinois, 1970; and
 
WHEREAS, The Board of Trustees of the Village of North Utica, LaSalle County,
Illinois (“the Village”), after full investigation and consideration, has
determined it to be in the best interests of the citizens of the Village, and
where it is further believed to be necessary and appropriate that certain
sections of the Alcoholic Beverage Ordinance, Title 3, Chapter 2 of the
Village’s Ordinances, be amended as follows below:
 
   NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE PRESIDENT AND BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF THE
VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA, LASALLE COUNTY, ILLINOIS, AS FOLLOWS:
 
SECTION 1:    Section 3-2-4, Licenses Required; Classifications; Fees, shall be
amended to provide for the issuance of an additional license classification as
follows:
   
A.    Class H-1 – Non-profit Temporary License:
   
(1)    A Class H-1, Non-profit Temporary License, shall permit the retail sale
of alcoholic liquor for consumption only on the premises where it is sold and
not for resale in any form. A Class H-1, Non-profit Temporary License, is to be
issued for temporary stands, booths, and counters, such as those used at
festivals, special events, celebrations and the like. Such temporary license
shall be granted to local not-for-profit organizations legally chartered as
such or governmental entities, for community events. The said Class H-
1 temporary license shall be valid only on the day for which said permit is
issued, and only during the hours of said day during which alcoholic liquor may
be sold within the Village. The boundaries of the licensed premises and the
duration of the license shall be established by the Village Liquor
Commissioner. The licensee shall maintain the premises in a neat, orderly and
safe condition, shall provide such traffic control and sanitation facilities to
protect the public health, safety, welfare and morals of the residents of the
Village, and shall restore premises after expiration of the license to its
prior condition, including the removal of trash, rubbish and garbage. No
alcoholic liquor shall be brought onto the premises or consumed on the premises
other than that provided by the licensee under the terms and conditions of this
chapter.
 
(2)    The number of Class H-1, Non-profit Temporary Licenses, which may be
issued to any one applicant in any license year shall be limited to six (6).
 
(3)    The Village Liquor Control Commissioner may, at his/her discretion,
grant additional Class H-1, Non-profit Temporary Licenses on such terms and
conditions as are acceptable to the Village Liquor Control Commissioner.
   
(Ord.#2024-11, dtd 04-11-2024)
 
B.    Class H-2 – For-profit Temporary License:
 
(1)    A Class H-2, For-profit Temporary License, shall permit the retail sale
of alcoholic liquor for consumption on or off the premises where it is sold and
not for resale in any form. A Class H-2, temporary license, is to be issued to
a) a winery for the sale of its wine or microbrewery for the sale of its
crafted beer; or b) a distillery for the sales of its spirits; or c) for a
license holder in good standing of a Class A, retail license, to allow sales
off premises in conjunction with a special event held in the Village. The
license is only available in conjunction with an H-1 license issued for a
special event. The Class H-2 applicant must submit a currently valid liquor
license from the municipality where the licensee is primarily based and proof
of insurance satisfactory to the Village Liquor Control Commissioner.
 
(2)    The said Class H-2, For-profit Temporary License, shall be valid only on
the day(s) for which said license is issued, and only during the hours of said
day during which alcoholic liquor may be sold within the Village. The
boundaries of the licensed premises and the duration of the license shall be
established by the Village Liquor Commissioner. The licensee shall maintain the
premises in a neat, orderly and safe condition, shall provide such traffic
control and sanitation facilities to protect the public health, safety, welfare
and morals of the residents of the Village, and shall restore premises after
expiration of the license to its prior condition, including the removal of
trash, rubbish and garbage. No alcoholic liquor shall be brought onto the
premises or consumed on the premises other than that provided by the licensee
under the terms and conditions of this chapter.
 
(3)    The number of Class H-2, For-profit Temporary License, which may be
issued to any one applicant in any license year shall be limited to six (6).
 
(4)    The Village Liquor Control Commissioner may, at his/her discretion,
grant additional Class H-2, For-profit Temporary Licenses on such terms and
conditions as are acceptable to the Village Local Liquor Commissioner.
 
(5)    This temporary license authorizes the licensee the retail sale of beer,
wine, or spirits on the specified premises. The retail sale and consumption of
alcoholic beverages authorized through a special event license, shall be
limited to the premises specified in the application.
 
(Ord.#2024-11, dtd 04-11-2024)
 
SECTION 2:    Section 3-2-10, Number of Licenses, shall be amended to provide
for the issuance of a Class H-1, Non-profit Temporary License and a Class H-2,
For-profit Temporary License, as follows:
 
Class H-1 Non-profit Temporary License:   No more than 6
(Ord.#2024-11, dtd 04-11-2024)
 
Class H-2 For-profit Temporary License:   No more than 6    
 (Ord.#2024-11, dtd 04-11-2024)
 
SECTION 3:    All parts of Ordinances or Amendments in conflict herewith are
hereby repealed.
 
SECTION 4:    This Ordinance shall be effective as of its adoption.

ORDINANCE NO. 2024 - 17
 
AN ORDINANCE AMENDING THE ZONING ORDINANCE
AND GRANTING OF SPECIAL USE
BY THE VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA, LASALLE COUNTY, ILLINOIS
(Sec. 10-8B-2 (C2) Permitted Use & 10-8B- 3 (C2) Special Uses)
(Public School District Building)
________________________________________________________________________
 
WHEREAS, the Village of North Utica is a home-rule municipality in accordance
with the Constitution of the State of Illinois of 1970; and    
 
WHEREAS, Ordinance 04-26 adopted September 22, 2004, as amended, of the Village
Code governs zoning; and
 
WHEREAS, the Planning Commission held a public hearing on May 23, 2024,
regarding amending said Zoning Ordinance; and
 
WHEREAS, the Planning Commission has recommended by a vote of 4-voting Aye, 0-
voting Nay, 2-Absent, and the Chair not voting, that the amendment contained
herein to the Zoning Ordinance be adopted; and
 
   WHEREAS, the Board of Trustees of the Village of North Utica, LaSalle
County, Illinois, (the “Village”), after full investigation and consideration,
has determined it to be in the best interests of the citizens of the Village,
and further believe it to be necessary and appropriate that the Zoning
Ordinance of the Village Code be amended as follows below:
 
   NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE PRESIDENT AND BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF THE
VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA, LASALLE COUNTY, ILLINOIS, AS FOLLOWS:
 
SECTION 1:   Title 10, Chapter 8B-2, C-2 General Commercial District, Permitted
Uses, first sentence is deleted and replaced by the following as shown on
Exhibit A which is incorporated herein by reference.
 
SECTION 2:   Title 10, Chapter 8B-3, C-2 General Commercial District, Special
Uses, of the Village Code is amended as shown on Exhibit B , which is
incorporated herein by reference.
 
SECTION 3:   Waltham Community Consolidated School District No. 185 is hereby
granted a Special Use to operate a public school at that property described on
the attached Exhibit C .
SECTION 4:   Other Ordinances: Any other Village Ordinances existing as of the
date which are in conflict with this Ordinance are hereby repealed. This
Ordinance shall supersede where inconsistent with any and all ordinances in
conflict herewith.
 
SECTION 5:   Severability: In the event that any part or portion of this
Ordinance, or any provision, clause, wording, or designation contained within
this Ordinance, is held to be invalid by any court of competent jurisdiction,
such part, portion, provision, clause, wording, or designation shall be excised
from this Ordinance and the invalidity thereof shall not affect the remaining
portions of this Ordinance.
 
SECTION 6:   This Ordinance is adopted pursuant to the home-rule authority of
the Village and shall be in full force and effect from and after its passage,
approval, and publication in pamphlet form as required by law.
 
PRESENTED, PASSED and ACCEPTED at a special meeting of the Board of Trustees of
the Village of North Utica, Illinois on 23 rd day of May, 2024.

with the Constitution of the State of Illinois of 1970; and

herein to the Zoning Ordinance be adopted; and

County, Illinois, (the “Village”), after full investigation and consideration,
has determined it to be in the best interests of the citizens of the Village,
and further believe it to be necessary and appropriate that the Zoning

amended as shown on Exhibit B , which is incorporated herein by reference.

Uses, of the Village Code is amended as shown on Exhibit C , which is
incorporated herein by reference.

the Village and shall be in full force and effect from and after its passage,

MODULAR UNIT     A small self-contained structure containing rooms used for
educational CLASSROOM      purposes by a licensed school district.

EXHIBIT B
 
TITLE 10, CHAPTER 4
 
GENERAL ZONING PROVISIONS 
 
 
10-4-5      MOBILE HOMES / MODULAR UNIT CLASSROOMS :
 
B.   Location in Parks Only: Mobile homes used as residences, commercial uses,
or storage shall only be located on lots in approved mobile home parks, except
such may be permitted as a Special use in the C-2 General Commercial District,
provided such are located on a lot with a permanent structure containing an
operating commercial business on the same lot.
 
   Modular Unit Classrooms are also permitted as a Special Use in C-2 General
Commercial District, provided such are located on the same lot, or a lot
contiguous to an operating licensed school district.
(Ord. 2007-24, 8-8-2007; Amd Ord. 2023-05, 04-13-2023; Amd Ord. 2024-18, 05-23-
2024)

contiguous to an operating licensed school district.

with the Constitution of the State of Illinois of 1970; and

Ordinance be adopted; and

has determined it to be in the best interests of the citizens of the Village,
and further believe it to be necessary and appropriate that the Zoning

date which are in conflict with this Ordinance are hereby repealed. This

File #15-67-03
VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA,
COUNTY OF LASALLE,
STATE OF ILLINOIS
 
ORDINANCE NO. 2024 - 28
 
AN ORDINANCE AMENDING THE BUSINESS & LICENSE REGULATIONS
OF THE VILLAGE CODE ORDINANCE
OF THE VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA, LASALLE COUNTY, ILLINOIS
(Title 3-Chapter 13-Raffles)
 
 
PREAMBLE
   WHEREAS, the Village of North Utica (the “Village”) is a home-rule
municipality in accordance with the Constitution of the State of Illinois, and
has the authority to adopt ordinances and to promulgate rules and regulations
that pertain to its government affairs and that protect the public health,
safety and welfare of its citizens; and
 
   WHEREAS, previously the Village adopted Ordinance No. 2022-33 pursuant to
the provisions of 230 ILCS 15/ (“Raffles & Poker Runs Act”) and pursuant to the
home-rule authority of the Village.
   
   WHEREAS, Village Ordinance No. 2022-33, as amended, imposes regulations on
raffles and/or poker runs as provided to municipalities.
 
   WHEREAS, the Board of Trustees of the Village of North Utica, LaSalle
County, Illinois, after full consideration, believes it necessary and in the
best interest of the Village to further amend Village Ordinance No. 2022-33.
 
   NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT ORDAINED BY THE PRESIDENT AND BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF THE
VILLAGE OF NORTH UTICA, LASALLE COUNTY, ILLINOIS, THAT:
 
SECTION 1. Recitals. The facts and statements contained in the preamble to this
Ordinance are found to be true and correct and are hereby adopted as part of
this Ordinance.
 
SECTION 2.   Title 3, Business and License Regulations, Chapter 13, Raffles is
amended as follows:
 
3-13-6:      LIMITATIONS ON LICENSES:
 
A.   A license authorizes the licensee to conduct raffles as defined in this
chapter. Each such license is valid for one raffle.  
 
The Village shall issue no more than two (2) Progressive Raffle licenses within
a calendar year and only one (1) Progressive Raffle shall be ongoing at any one
(1) time. No organization shall be entitled to receive more than one (1)  Two
(2)  Progressive Raffle license in a calendar year.
   (Amd. Ord 2023-26, 09-14-2023; Amd. Ord.2024-28, 06-13-2024)
 
 
SECTION 3. Severability. If any provision of this Ordinance, or the application
of any provision of this Ordinance, is held unconstitutional or otherwise
invalid, such occurrence shall not affect other provisions of this Ordinance,
or their application, that can be given effect without the unconstitutional or
invalid provision or its application. Each unconstitutional or invalid
provision, or application of such provision, is severable, unless otherwise
provided by this Ordinance.
 
SECTION 4. Effective Date. This Ordinance is adopted pursuant to the home-rule
authority of the Village and shall be in full force and effect from and after
its passage and approval and publication as required by law.

TITLE 1
ADMINISTRATION
CHAPTER 1
NORTH UTICA VILLAGE CODE
SECTION:
1-1-1: Title
1-1-2: Acceptance
1-1-3: Amendments
1-1-4: Code Alterations
1-1-5: Copies Of Code
1-1-1: TITLE:
Upon the adoption by the village board of trustees, this code is hereby
declared to be and shall hereafter constitute the official village code of
North Utica. This code of ordinances shall be known and cited as the NORTH
UTICA VILLAGE CODE and is hereby published by authority of the village board of
trustees and shall be supplemented to incorporate the most recent legislation
of the village as provided in section
1-1-3 of this chapter. Any reference to the number of any section contained
herein shall be understood to refer to the position of the same number, its
appropriate chapter and title heading, and to the general penalty clause
relating thereto, as well as to the section itself, when reference is made to
this code by title in any legal documents. (2013 Code)
1-1-2: ACCEPTANCE:
This code, as hereby presented in printed form, shall hereafter be received
without further proof in all courts and in administrative tribunals of this
state as the ordinances of the village of general and permanent effect, except
the excluded ordinances enumerated in section
1-2-1 of this title. (2013 Code)
1-1-3: AMENDMENTS:
Any ordinance amending this code shall set forth the title, chapter and section
number of the section or sections to be amended, and this shall constitute
sufficient compliance with any statutory requirement pertaining to the
amendment or revision by ordinance of any part of this code. All such
amendments or revisions by ordinance shall be immediately forwarded to the
codifiers, and the said ordinance material shall be prepared for insertion in
its proper place in each copy of this code. Each such replacement page shall be
properly identified and shall be inserted in each individual copy of this code.
(2013 Code)
1-1-4: CODE ALTERATIONS:
It shall be deemed unlawful for any person to alter, change, replace or deface
in any way any section or any page of this code in such a manner that the
meaning of any phrase or order may be changed or omitted. Said code, while in
actual possession of officials and other interested persons, shall be and
remain the property of the village and shall be returned to the office of the
village clerk when directed so to do by order of the village board of trustees.
(2013 Code)
1-1-5: COPIES OF CODE:
   A.   Copies To Village Officials: All of the printed copies of this code
belonging to the village shall be deposited with the clerk. He shall deliver
one copy thereof to the president and each member of the board of trustees and
copies to such other persons as the president and board of trustees may direct.
(1966 Code § 651)
   B.   Copies To Other Bodies: The president and board of trustees shall have
the power to extend or reciprocate courtesies of other municipalities by
presenting them with a copy of this code, bound at the expense of the village,
as to them as shall seem suitable, and they shall also have the power to
present two (2) copies of this code to the Illinois municipal league. (1966
Code § 652)
CHAPTER 2
SAVING CLAUSE
SECTION:
1-2-1: Repeal Of General Ordinances
1-2-2: Public Ways And Public Utility Ordinances
1-2-3: Court Proceedings
1-2-4: Severability Clause
1-2-1: REPEAL OF GENERAL ORDINANCES:
All general ordinances of the village passed prior to the adoption of this code
are hereby repealed, except such as are included in this code or are by
necessary implication herein reserved from repeal (subject to the saving
clauses contained in the following sections), and excluding the following
ordinances which are not hereby repealed:
   A.   Tax levy ordinances;
   B.   Appropriation ordinances;
   C.   Ordinances relating to boundaries and annexations;
   D.   Franchise ordinances and other ordinances granting special rights to
persons or corporations;
   E.   Contract ordinances and ordinances authorizing the execution of a
contract or the issuance of warrants;
   F.   Salary ordinances;
   G.   Ordinances establishing, naming or vacating streets, alleys or other
public places;
   H.   Improvement ordinances;
   I.   Bond ordinances;
   J.   Ordinances relating to elections;
   K.   Ordinances relating to the transfer or acceptance of real estate by or
from the village; and
   L.   All special ordinances. (2013 Code)
1-2-2: PUBLIC WAYS AND PUBLIC UTILITY ORDINANCES:
No ordinance relating to railroad crossings with streets and other public ways,
or relating to the conduct, duties, service or rates of public utilities shall
be repealed by virtue of the adoption of this code or by virtue of section
1-2-1 of this chapter, excepting as this code may contain provisions for such
matters, in which case, this code shall be considered as amending such
ordinance or ordinances with respect to such provisions only. (2013 Code)
1-2-3: COURT PROCEEDINGS:
   A.   Prior Acts: No new ordinance shall be construed or held to repeal a
former ordinance, whether such former ordinance is expressly repealed or not,
as to any offense committed against such former ordinance or as to any act
done, any penalty, forfeiture or punishment so incurred, or any right accrued
or claim arising under the former ordinance, or in any way whatever to affect
any such offense or act so committed or so done, or any penalty, forfeiture or
punishment so incurred or any right accrued or claim arising before the new
ordinance takes effect, save only that the proceedings thereafter shall conform
to the ordinance in force at the time of such proceeding, so far as
practicable. If any penalty, forfeiture or punishment may be mitigated by any
provision of a new ordinance, such provision may be, by consent of the party
affected, applied to any judgment announced after the new ordinance takes
effect.
   B.   Extend To All Repeals: This section shall extend to all repeals, either
by express words or implication, whether the repeal is in the ordinance making
any new provisions upon the same subject or in any other ordinance.
   C.   Current Pending Actions: Nothing contained in this chapter shall be
construed as abating any action now pending under or by virtue of any general
ordinance of the village herein repealed, and the provisions of all general
ordinances contained in this code shall be deemed to be continuing provisions
and not a new enactment of the same provisions; nor shall this chapter be
deemed as discontinuing, abating, modifying or altering any penalty accrued or
to accrue, or as affecting the liability of any person, firm or corporation, or
as waiving any right of the village under any ordinance or provision thereof in
force at the time of the adoption of this code. (2013 Code)
1-2-4: SEVERABILITY CLAUSE:
If any section, subsection, paragraph, sentence, clause or phrase of this code
or any part thereof is for any reason held to be unconstitutional or invalid or
ineffective by any court of competent jurisdiction, such decision shall not
affect the validity or effectiveness of the remaining portions of this code, or
any part thereof. The village board of trustees hereby declares that it would
have passed each section, subsection, paragraph, sentence, clause or phrase
thereof irrespective of the fact that any one or more sections, subsections,
subdivisions, paragraphs, sentences, clauses or phrases be declared
unconstitutional, invalid or ineffective. (2013 Code)
CHAPTER 3
DEFINITIONS; INTERPRETATION
SECTION:
1-3-1: General Rules Of Interpretation
1-3-2: General Definitions
1-3-3: Catchlines
1-3-1: GENERAL RULES OF INTERPRETATION:
   A.   Liberal Construction: All general provisions, terms, phrases and
expressions contained in this code shall be liberally construed in order that
the true intent and meaning of the village board of trustees may be fully
carried out.
   B.   Minimum Requirements: In the interpretation and application of any
provisions of this code, they shall be held to be the minimum requirements
adopted for the promotion of the public health, safety, comfort, convenience
and general welfare. Where any provision of this code imposes greater
restrictions upon the subject matter than the general provision imposed by this
code, the provision imposing the greater restriction or regulation shall be
deemed to be controlling. (2013 Code)
   C.   Time:
      1.   Computation Of Time: The time within which any act provided by law
is to be done shall be computed by excluding the first day and including the
last, unless the last day is a Saturday, Sunday or a holiday as defined or
fixed in any statute now or hereafter in force in the state, and then it shall
also be excluded. If the day succeeding such Saturday, Sunday or holiday is
also a holiday or a Saturday or Sunday, then such succeeding day shall also be
excluded. (1966 Code § 96)
      2.   Official Time: Central Standard Time shall be the official time for
the transaction of the village business; except, that the village time shall
coincide with daylight saving time as used in Illinois. All clocks and other
timepieces in or upon public buildings or other premises maintained by or at
the expense of the village shall be set and run at the official time prescribed
by this subsection. (1966 Code § 96; amd. 2013 Code)
   D.   Delegation Of Authority: Whenever a provision appears requiring the
head of a department or some other village officer to do some act or perform
some duty, it is to be construed to authorize the head of the department or
other officer to designate, delegate and authorize subordinates to perform the
required act or perform the duty unless the terms of the provision or section
specify otherwise.
   E.   Gender: A word importing the masculine gender only shall extend and be
applied to females and to firms, partnerships and corporations as well as to
males.
   F.   Joint Authority: All words giving a joint authority to three (3) or
more persons or officers shall be construed as giving such authority to a
majority of such persons or officers.
   G.   May/Shall: The word "may" is permissive; the word "shall" is mandatory.
   H.   Nontechnical And Technical Words: Words and phrases shall be construed
according to the common and approved usage of the language, but technical words
and phrases and such others as may have acquired a peculiar and appropriate
meaning in law shall be construed and understood according to such meaning.
   I.   Number: A word importing the singular number only may extend and be
applied to several persons and things as well as to one person and thing.
   J.   Officers And Employees Generally: Whenever any officer or employee is
referred to by title only, such reference shall be construed as if followed by
the words "of the village of North Utica".
   K.   Tense: Words used in the past or present tense include the future as
well as the past and present.
   L.   Ordinance: The word "ordinance" contained in the ordinances of the
village has been changed in the content of this code to "title", "chapter",
"section" and/or "subsection" or words of like import for organizational and
clarification purposes only. Such change to the village ordinances is not meant
to amend passage and effective dates of such original ordinances. (2013 Code)
1-3-2: GENERAL DEFINITIONS:
Whenever the following words or terms are used in this code, they shall have
the meanings herein ascribed to them, unless the context makes such meaning
repugnant thereto:
AGENT: A person acting on behalf of another with authority conferred, either
expressly or by implication.
BOARD OF TRUSTEES, BOARD: Unless otherwise indicated, the village board of
trustees of the village of North Utica.
CODE: The village code of the village of North Utica.
CORPORATE LIMITS OR VILLAGE LIMITS: The legal boundaries of the village, except
as otherwise provided by law.
COUNTY: The county of LaSalle, state of Illinois.
FISCAL YEAR: The fiscal year for the village shall begin on April 1 of each
year and end on March 31 of the following year.
LICENSE: The permission granted for the carrying on of a business, profession
or occupation.
MAYOR: The mayor of the village.
MONTH: A calendar month.
NUISANCE: Anything offensive to the sensibilities of reasonable persons, or any
act or activity creating a hazard which threatens the health and welfare of
inhabitants of the village, or any activity which, by its perpetuation, can
reasonably be said to have a detrimental effect on the property of a person or
persons within the community.
OATH: Shall include an affirmation in all cases in which, by law, an
affirmation may be substituted for an oath, and in such cases the words "swear"
and "sworn" shall be equivalent to the words "affirm" and "affirmed".
OCCUPANT: As applied to a building or land, shall include any person who
occupies the whole or any part of such building or land, whether alone or with
others.
OFFENSE: Any act forbidden by any provision of this code or the omission of any
act required by the provisions of this code.
OPERATOR: The person who is in charge of any operation, business or profession.
OWNER: As applied to a building or land, shall include any part owner, joint
owner, tenant in common, joint tenant or lessee of the whole or of a part of
such building or land.
PERSON: Any public or private corporation, firm, partnership, association,
organization, government or any other group acting as a unit, as well as a
natural person.
PERSONAL PROPERTY: Shall include every description of money, goods, chattels,
effects, evidence of rights in action and all written instruments by which any
pecuniary obligation, right or title to property is created, acknowledged,
transferred, increased, defeated, discharged or diminished and every right or
interest therein.
PRECEDING, FOLLOWING: Next before and next after, respectively.
PRESIDENT: The president of the village board of trustees.
PROPERTY: Shall include real, personal and mixed property.
